name: exhibitionistic
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
mainly disapproving behaving in a way that is intended to attract attention to yourself: She somehow seems both shy and shamelessly exhibitionistic. Is anyone really interested in the exhibitionistic behaviour of minor celebrities?
psychology
  specialized relating to the act of intentionally showing the sexual organs in public: He was suffering from an exhibitionistic disorder.
More examplesFewer examplesHer art is the opposite of exhibitionistic; it is intensely private and restrained.Social media is the one of the most exhibitionistic methods of communication we have yet developed.Their generation has grown up in an exhibitionistic era.She had an exhibitionistic desire for applause and praise.
